Class ContactsApp

java.lang.Object
ContactsApp
public class ContactsApp extends Object
The class ContactsApp holds the main method that is used to run the final application. This application uses a GUI and is run by asking the end user for inputs. The application uses a list of contacts that it stores in a separate text file named "Contactsbook.txt" and it refers to it when loading and saving information.
Author:
Juho Yli-Rajala

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • addNewPerson

      public static void addNewPerson(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to add a new Person object to the contacts ArrayList. This method simply starts asking different info a Person object must have and then constructs a new Person object and adds it to the given ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      contactsbook - This methods requires an existing ArrayList where to store the new Person object.
      id - This is a String that stores the end users input for id and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      fname - This is a String that stores the end users input for firstname and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      lname - This is a String that stores the end users input for lastname and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      phoneno - This is a String that stores the end users input for phonenumber and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      address - This is a String that stores the end users input for address which can also be empty and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      email - This is a String that stores the end users input for email address which can also be empty and the method then proceeds to validate it using the class Verify.
      newcontact - This is the newly constructed Person object that uses all the end users given and validated input as its info. This new Person object is then stored into the given ArrayList contactsbook.

    • searchPerson

      public static void searchPerson(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to search for a certain Person object from the contacts ArrayList. The method first asks who the end user is searching for and if something related to the end users input was found it shows a separate messagedialog containing all the Person objects info related to the input. If many Person objects share the same name etc. it shows every Person object related to that one end users input one at a time.
      Parameters:
      contactsbook - This methods requires an existing ArrayList where to search everything from.
      found - This is a boolean value that is set false by default and it is used to show a messagedialog if nothing was found.
      input - This is a String that holds the end users input when searching for a Person object from the ArrayList contactsbook.
      y - This is the Person object that has been found based on the String input.

    • updateContacts

      public static void updateContacts(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to update a certain Person object in the contacts ArrayList. The method first asks who the end user is searching for and if something related to the end users input was found it asks if the end user wants to proceed updating this Person object showing the contacts info simultaneously. The method saves the everything after being called using the separate method for saving.
      Parameters:
      contactsbook - This methods requires an existing ArrayList where to search everything from.
      found - This is a boolean value that is set false by default and it is used to show a messagedialog if nothing was found.
      input - This is a String that holds the end users input when searching for a Person object from the ArrayList contactsbook.
      y - This is the Person object that has been found based on the String input.

    • deletePerson

      public static void deletePerson(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to delete a certain Person object from the contacts ArrayList. The method first asks who the end user is searching for and if something related to the end users input was found it asks if the end user wants to proceed deleting this Person object showing the contacts info simultaneously. The method saves the everything after being called using the separate method for saving.
      Parameters:
      contactsbook - This methods requires an existing ArrayList where to search everything from.
      found - This is a boolean value that is set false by default and it is used to show a messagedialog if nothing was found.
      input - This is a String that holds the end users input when searching for a Person object from the ArrayList contactsbook.
      y - This is the Person object that has been found based on the String input.

    • saveContacts

      public static void saveContacts(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to save the whole ArrayList into the text file "Contactsbook.txt".
      Parameters:
      contactsbook - This is the current ArrayList that holds different Person objects information.
      personinfo - This is the Person object which info is currently being set as one single String currentperson.
      currentperson - This is a String constructed using personinfos get methods and the separating each piece of info with a char ','.
      infoholder - This is a new FileWriter that stores everything in the text file "Contactsbook.txt".
      contactsholder - This is a new PrintWriter that prints one Person objects info using the String currentperson into a sigle line into the text file.
      Throws:
      e - Throws an IOExeption.

    • loadContacts

      public static ArrayList<Person> loadContacts()
      This method is used to load the whole separate text file "Contactsbook.txt" into an ArrayList. The method first separates all the information the text file has by splitting the information based on the char ','. Then the method constructs a Person object using this information and as the BufferedReader finishes a line in the text file it continues reading the next one but now constructing a new Person object separate from the last one and continues this as long as the next line is not null.
      Parameters:
      contactslist - An ArrayList that is filled by the multiple Person objects information the text file "Contactsbook.txt" has.
      personinfo - This String holds a whole line (one Person objects information) fetched from the text file.
      tokens - This is a String that holds the current Person objects information in the String personinfo split by the char ','.
      id - A Person objects id that is found in the tokens first field.
      fname - A Person objects firstname that is found in the tokens second field.
      lname - A Person objects lastname that is found in the tokens third field.
      phone - A Person objects phone number that is found in the tokens fourth field.
      add - A Person objects address that is found in the tokens fifth field.
      email - A Person objects email that is found in the tokens sixth field.
      currentp - This is a new Person object that is then stored into the ArrayList contactslist.
      bookreader - This is a new FileReader that goes through the text file "Contactsbook.txt".
      inforader - This is a new BufferedReader that stores the current Person objects info (one single line in the text file).
      Returns:
      Returns the new ArrayList contactslist.
      Throws:
      e - Throws an IOExeption.

    • clearContacts

      public static void clearContacts(ArrayList contactsbook)
      This method is used to clear the whole contactsbook ArrayList and then saving it, also clearing the separate text file "Contactsbook.txt".
      Parameters:
      yesno - This is simply a String that holds a value "1" or "2" depending on if the end user wants to clear the whole contactsbook.
